alert.note: Alert for Brantley; Northeastern Charlton (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Jacksonville (Northeast Florida and Southeast Georgia)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 28 at 8:07PM EDT by NWS Jacksonville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Brantley and northeastern Charlton Counties through 845 PM EDT... At 807 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm capable of producing a landspout near Fort Mudge, or 12 miles southwest of Nahunta, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Funnel clouds, winds around 40 mph, and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Fort Mudge, Hickox and Winokur. LANDSPOUT...POSSIBLE MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
